Comments_List: I learned mathematical models for exploring a number of questions in international finance.
I dived deeper into the topic of international finance and relevant models, and learned how to do my economic research.

I learned a number of models in this course to explain a number of phenomena. The instructor did an excellent job in incorporating economic data and explaining how the theories discussed fit (or do not fit) the data. The instructor also engaged with students personally. However, the instructor could have brought more emotion into the lectures to improve student engagement during lectures. I believe that many course dropped the course at the beginning of the semester for this reason, and those who stuck with the course gained from all of these advantages.
The class size is small so we can interact a lot with the professor. But perhaps also due to the small size, class atmosphere is not that active:
Yes, if you're interested in the area. If not, it would be a lot of work for something most people would find relatively boring.
